SAIC Alums Jeffrey Gibson and Walter Hood Named MacArthur Fellows

Jeffrey Gibson (BFA 1995), multidisciplinary artist and craftsperson, and Walter Hood (MFA 2013), landscape and public artist, were awarded 2019 MacArthur “genius" grants. In the past four years, five SAIC alums or faculty have been awarded this prestigious honor.
read more about this prestigious honor
Nick Cave Named One of the Greats
Acclaimed artist and professor of Fashion, Body and Garment, Nick Cave is featured in the New York Times: T Style Magazine's "Greats" issue alongside three renowned talents.

From LEDs to Bees: SAIC Achieves Carbon Neutrality and Advances Sustainability Efforts
From LEDs to bees and renewable energy in between, for the past 10 years the School of the Art Institute of Chicago (SAIC) has been busy becoming a sustainable and resilient campus.
Sharing My First-Generation Story: Sadie Woods
Sadie Woods (MFA 2016), lecturer in Contemporary Practices, shares her experience as a first-generation college graduate.

For more than 150 years, the School of the Art Institute of Chicago (SAIC) has been a leader in educating the world’s most influential artists, designers, and scholars. Located in downtown Chicago with a fine arts graduate program consistently ranking among the top programs in the nation by

, SAIC provides an interdisciplinary approach to art and design as well as world-class resources, including the Art Institute of Chicago museum, on-campus galleries, and state-of-the-art facilities. SAIC’s undergraduate, graduate, and post-baccalaureate students have the freedom to take risks and create the bold ideas that transform Chicago and the world—as seen through notable alumni and faculty such as Michelle Grabner, David Sedaris, Elizabeth Murray, Richard Hunt, Georgia O’Keeffe, Cynthia Rowley, Nick Cave, Jeff Koons, and LeRoy Neiman.
